intro: Galium oshtenicum, commonly known as the Oshten's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by slender, often hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Galium oshtenicum is typically found in the northeastern United States and parts of Canada.
